alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 7:54PM MST until March 16 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Arizona... Verde River above Clarkdale affecting Yavapai County. For the Verde River...including Clarkdale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Verde River above Clarkdale. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, High flow could lead to bank erosion and water ponding in backwater catch basins. At 12.0 feet, Nuisance flooding of property along riverbanks. At 15.0 feet, Inundation of homes along Bates Road and Rio Verde RV park in Cottonwood begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MST Wednesday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM MST Wednesday was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river could crest at 15 feet later tonight. It will fall below flood stage by tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 08/01/2010. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Verde River Clarkdale 12.0 13.6 Wed 7 pm MST 8.9 5.2 4.0 &&
info.instruction: Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz
